description: Research initiative to investigate CSS Design Token migration challenges from PatternFly 5 to 6, identifying gaps not covered by pf-codemods

userStories.title: Phase 1 - Foundational Understanding
userStories.description: As a tool builder, I need foundational knowledge of CSS Design Tokens and PatternFly's implementation so that I understand the problem domain before analyzing gaps.
acceptanceCriteria: Research CSS Design Tokens as a general concept (what they are, W3C spec, implementation patterns)
Document PatternFly 6's three-layer token system: Palette → Base → Semantic
Document naming conventions (--pf-t--[scope]--[component]--[property]--[concept]--[variant]--[state])
Document v5 → v6 naming transformations with examples
Document React token format changes (global_FontSize_lg → t_global_font_size_lg)
Output saved to research/01_design_tokens_fundamentals.md
Checkpoint passed: Can explain design tokens, PatternFly's token layers, and naming changes to an unfamiliar developer

userStories.title: Phase 2 - Existing Tooling Analysis
userStories.description: As a tool builder, I need to understand what pf-codemods handles so that I can identify where complementary tooling is needed.
acceptanceCriteria: Analyze pf-codemods v6 rules repository structure
Catalog all CSS/token-related codemods with their transformation logic
Document detection patterns used (regex, AST, etc.)
Deep-dive on class-name-updater - what it catches and misses
Deep-dive on tokens-update - React token transformations
Deep-dive on css-vars-updater - CSS variable updates in non-React files
Document 'hot pink' fallback behavior for unmatchable tokens
List scenarios explicitly marked as requiring manual intervention
Output saved to research/02_pf_codemods_analysis.md
Checkpoint passed: Can articulate exactly what pf-codemods handles and where it explicitly stops

userStories.title: Phase 3 - Gap Identification
userStories.description: As a tool builder, I need a categorized inventory of migration gaps so that I can prioritize tooling development efforts.
acceptanceCriteria: Research scenarios where 1:1 token mappings don't exist (removed, consolidated, split, semantic changes)
Categorize custom CSS override patterns (direct variable overrides, class-based overrides, nested selectors, media queries)
Document decision points requiring human judgment (choosing tokens, deciding if override needed, handling removed functionality)
Each gap category includes concrete code examples showing v5 pattern, why pf-codemods doesn't handle it, what developer must decide, and v6 resolution options
Output saved to research/03_migration_gaps_analysis.md
Checkpoint passed: Have a categorized inventory of gap types with concrete examples of each

userStories.title: Phase 4 - Technical Deep Dive
userStories.description: As a tool builder, I need implementation-ready technical details so that I can begin prototyping detection and suggestion logic.
acceptanceCriteria: Create mapping documentation: V5 → V6 tokens (where mappings exist), V5 with no direct mapping, new V6 tokens
Document detection patterns: regex for v5 CSS variables, file types/locations for overrides, AST considerations
Identify heuristics for suggesting replacements: semantic similarity, context-based suggestions, confidence scoring
Output saved to research/04_technical_implementation_details.md
Checkpoint passed: Have enough technical detail to begin prototyping detection and suggestion logic

userStories.title: Phase 5 - Migration Workflow Analysis
userStories.description: As a tool builder, I need to understand the developer migration workflow so that tooling can intervene at the right points.
acceptanceCriteria: Map the complete migration workflow: Discovery, Analysis, Resolution, Validation stages
Categorize scenarios by frequency and difficulty: quick wins, moderate effort, complex cases
Document pain points at each workflow stage: missing information, hardest decisions, where developers get stuck
Output saved to research/05_migration_workflow_analysis.md
Checkpoint passed: Can describe end-to-end technical journey with identified intervention points

userStories.title: Phase 6 - Synthesis and Recommendations
userStories.description: As a tool builder, I need consolidated findings and prioritized recommendations so that I can make informed decisions about tooling development.
acceptanceCriteria: Prioritize gap categories by frequency, difficulty, and automation potential
Define tool requirements: must-have capabilities, nice-to-have features, out-of-scope items
Create executive summary for rapid onboarding (1 page)
Output saved to research/06_synthesis_and_recommendations.md
Output saved to research/00_executive_summary.md
Checkpoint passed: New team member can read executive summary and understand problem space
